title: Georestricted on Google Play
body:
The link in README.md to the Google Play store shows me only this error message:

> Sorry! This content is not available in your country yet.
> We're working to bring the content you love to more countries as quickly as possible.
> Please check back again soon.

I can't think of a reason why this is important, so it's probably unintentional. This is literally the only app on f-droid that I can't do without; do I really have to turn on "Uknown sources" just for this one app?

title: Whitelist currently connected to SSID
body:
Currently the only option to whitelist a network is to manually entet the ssid name. 
I think a great feature would be to add a button to add the current network to the Whitelist.

title: " will be forgotten"
body:
When I connect to an Open WiFi with the app installed, the message " will be forgotten" is displayed in a message at the bottom of the display for a short period.

I assume that you are displaying the contents of a variable at the start (probably the SSID of the WiFi connection) but it seems that it is an empty string for me.

Tested on:
Phone: Samsung Galaxy SII (GT-I9100) with Android 4.1.2 (Jelly Bean)
Tablet: Asus Transformer Prime (TF201) with Android 4.1.1 (Jelly Bean)

Thanks for the great app.

PS: You might be interested to know that I have mentioned the app in a blog post I created recently : http://www.fubra.com/blog/2014/04/04/staying-safe-cyberspace/

title: Open networks not being removed
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I am using the app on the following 2 devices and it does not seem to remove open Wi-Fi networks when they are "Not in range"...

Phone: Samsung Galaxy SII (GT-I9100) with Android 4.1.2 (Jelly Bean)
Tablet: Asus Transformer Prime (TF201) with Android 4.0.3 (Ice Cream Sandwich)

Happy to throw any debug info your way if you like - I'm a systems engineer hence have a GitHub account :)

Cheers, Ben

title: Cannot forget network after WiFi is switched off
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
If connected to an open network, it will not be forgotten if the WiFi radio is switched off. 

When the radio is turned back on, it will most likely reconnect to the open network if it is in range.
